name: Across the Pacific
description: A cocktail creation of Meaghan Dorman, bar director of Dear Irving and The Raines Law Room, New York. The Across the Pacific is another bitter tiki creation. The Averna Amaro brings dried fruit and raisin notes to the tropical, split-rum base cocktail.

name: Adios Motherfucker
description: You say goodbye, we say hello, and also, Adios Motherfucker!

name: Adonis
description: Nineteenth Century aperitif using sherry.

name: Afterglow
description: A famous alcohol-free cocktail.

name: Agua de valencia
description: One of the traditional cocktails of Valencia

name: Airmail
description: Though not fully official on account of the plane breaking down, the first attempt at modern airmail was documented in 1911. It traveled from Petaluma to Santa Rosa, California and contained exactly three pieces of correspondence. The first instance of the Air Mail cocktail was documented in Esquire magazine’s 1949 edition of Handbook for Hosts. It’s not certain why the drink is named for the modern delivery method, but it can be said the Air Mail is quite like the Caribbean version of a French 75, with a splash of lime whisked into a turbulent mix of rum, honey and Champagne.

name: Amaretto Sour
description: Combining amaretto with bourbon, fresh lemon juice, rich simple syrup, and egg white creates a perfectly balanced Amaretto Sour.

name: Americano
description:
The Americano is an IBA official cocktail composed of Campari, sweet vermouth, and for the sparkling version, club soda. The cocktail was first served in creator Gaspare Campari's bar, Caffè Campari, in the 1860s.

Serve on Ice!

name: American Trilogy
description: Brown sugar mingles with a half-rye, half-Applejack backbone to shift the classic into a slightly darker place.

name: Angevine Soup
description: The Angevine Soup is a French cocktail, typical of Anjou.

name: Aperol Spritz
description: A great cocktail for a summer weekend.

name: Apertass
description: Perfect drink for an appetizer.

name: AppleCider Margarita
description:
These apple cider margaritas are a seasonal twist on a classic cocktail recipe. Sweetened with maple syrup and garnished with a cinnamon sugar rim, these are perfect for Thanksgiving or another holiday gathering.

- Combine sugar, cinnamon, and salt on a small, flat plate.
- Pour a small amount of maple syrup on another small plate.
- Dip the rim of the glass in a bit of maple syrup, then coat into the cinnamon sugar mixture.
- Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice.
- Add all ingredients to cocktail shaker and shake vigorously for about 30 seconds.
- Strain into glass and enjoy!

name: Apple Jack
description:
A year round favorite served warm or cold.

- 3/4 fill a highball glass with cubed ice.
- Pour Old No. 7 over ice.
- Top with apple juice.
- Add apple slice to garnish.

name: Appletini
description: A sweet and sour electric green drink with a sweet, delicious apple flavor.

name: April Rain Cocktail
description: Bright, refreshing, and just slightly dry, the April rain is a wonderful cocktail that's sure to put you in a spring mood.

name: Aqueduct
description: The Aqueduct cocktail is made from vodka, Cointreau, apricot brandy and lime juice, and served in a cocktail glass.

name: Aviation
description: A classic cocktail made with gin, maraschino liqueur, creme de violette (optional), and lemon juice. This drink is meant to be served straight, and in a cocktail glass.

name: B-52
description: Believed to have originated in 1970 by a bartender and fan of the iconic band, the B-52 is classic guilty pleasure armed with three liqueurs. Make this layered shooter in seconds and impress all your friends.

name: Baby Guinness
description: A simple and sweet shot that resembles a baby pint of Guinness.

name: Bacardi Cocktail
description:
The Bacardí Cocktail became one of the most popular drinks of the period immediately following the repeal of Prohibition. It is a variation of the Daiquiri that involves rum, lime and grenadine. It is rare on menus today but was a stalwart of the 1930s bar repertoire.

Recommendation: Use Bacardi rum!

name: Bahama Mama
description: A blend of fruit juice and rum create this delicious, tropical cocktail.

name: Bangkok Sunrise
description: A drink that looks like a Bangkok sunrise. Shown in Danger 5, this is a wonderful cocktail that's sure to put you in a spring mood.

name: Barracuda
description: A well known cocktail of unknown origins, thought to date from the 1970s.

name: Barraquito
description: A multi-layered coffee drink.

name: Basil Smash
description: Enjoy a summer breezed basil flavoured cocktail.

name: Bay Breeze
description: A tropical, refreshing cocktail based on the classic Cape Cod.

name: Beam me up, Scotchie
description:
A simple Fall cocktail worthy of Scotty himself

Directions:
- Muddle ingredients
- Strain out fig seeds
- Serve in a cocktail glass over ice
- Garnish with figs

name: Beergarita
description: Beergarita combines beer with a freshly made margarita

name: Bee's Knees
description: The recipe allegedly appears in a 1930 edition of San Francisco bartender and author Bill Boothby’s cocktail compendium World Drinks and How to Mix Them. However, other evidence suggests Frank Meier, a bartender at the Ritz Paris, was the cocktail’s original creator. It appears in Meier’s 1936 edition of The Artistry of Mixing Drinks.

name: Bellini
description: Bellini is a sparkling Italian cocktail.

name: Between the Sheets
description: Also known as the Maiden’s Prayer, Between the Sheets is a flirty cocktail for sexy people!

name: Bijou
description: Pronounced Bee-Jew, this is a somewhat drier version of the classic cocktail included in the Harry Johnson's Bartender Manual from 1900

name: Bikini Martini
description: An awesome drink to sip by the pool! Garnish with an orange wheel.

name: Bitter but Good
description: A sweet quebecois/french-canadian take on a Negroni.

productionSteps.message: Stir until chilled. Strain into a rocks glass filled halfway with ice.

name: Black Martini
description: Black Martini is a famous cocktail beverage served at parties and special occasions, with plenty of variations.

name: Black Russian
description: This is a drink similar to White Russian, made with just vodka and coffee liqueur.

name: Blackthorn Cocktail
description: One of the few classics to highlight Irish whiskey

name: Blood and Sand
description: A sweet and citrus-y martini alternative.

productionSteps.message: Add ice to mixing tin and shake

name: Bloody Eyeball Shot
description: With a mix of coconut rum, Peach Schnapps, vodka, lychee fruits, and blueberries, you can be sure these boozy Halloween treats will work perfectly for your little haunted parties. Plus, these little creepy Halloween cocktails look like they have real eyes in them!

productionSteps.message: Create bloody eyeball garnish by placing a small amount of red jam into a lychee before adding a blueberry inside also.

name: Blue Hawaiian
description: The Blue Hawaiian is a tropical cocktail filled with rum, pineapple, and coconut!

productionSteps.message: Blend on high until smooth. Pour into chilled highball glass.

name: Blue Lady
description: A delicious blue Curacao & light rum mix

name: Blue Lagoon
description: Was created by Andy MacElhone at Harry's New York Bar in Paris in 1960. Andy MacElhone is none other than Harry's son, founder of Harry's New York Bar and inventor of the White Lady.

productionSteps.message: To make it fresher and lighter, fill the glass with crushed ice beforehand.

name: Blue Monday
description: A cocktail from Harry Craddock's 'Savoy Cocktail Book'.

name: Blue Vodka Lemonade
description: A twist to classic lemonade.

name: Bobby Burns
description: A whisky-based cocktail named after the scottish poet and lyricist.

name: Boomerang
description: A cocktail dating back to the early 1900s, popularized in the 'Official Mixer's Manual'.

name: Boulevardier
description: The Negroni but with bourbon! This strange creation is surprisingly brilliant and a wonderful choice if you’re interested in trying a new take on a traditional favorite.

name: Bourbon Lemonade
description: Little western kick to a summer classic.

name: Bourbon Mule
description: Mules are traditionally served in a copper mug, a handsome vessel that keeps them delightfully frigid.

name: Bourbon OldFashioned
description: When you get right down to it, the Bourbon Old Fashioned is little more than a slug of whiskey, seasoned and sweetened.

name: Brain Damage
description: Also known as a "Haemorrhage Shot", this short cocktail is supposedly named for its ability to kill brain cells, although the appearance and texture suggest more than one reason it may have gained its namesake.

name: Bramble
description: The Bramble is a spring cocktail created by Dick Bradsell in 1980s London, England. Bradsell suggests finishing off the cocktail with some fresh red fruits and a slice of lemon.

name: Brass Monkey
description: Brass Monkey

name: Breakfast Martini
description: Not strictly a Martini, merely served in a V-shaped Martini glass, this now world-famous cocktail was created in 1996 by bartender, raconteur and long term President of the United Kingdom Bartender's Guild, Salvatore Calabrese.

name: Bruce Wayne
description: Something magical happens to an iced coffee when you shake it with whiskey and maple syrup: You get a lovely, creamy head of foam on top — almost like a Guinness — that disguises the dark depths below (which contain enough caffeine to power any nocturnal superhero).

productionSteps.message: Shake until chilled and foamy and strain into your cocktail glass with ice.

name: Brunswick
description: Cocktail featuring wine floated over whiskey.

name: Bullfisher
description: The Bullfisher drink recipe is made from Malibu coconut rum, apple juice and ginger ale, and served over ice in a highball glass garnished with apple slices.

name: Californication
description: A mixture of run, vodka, tequila and gin finished with orange liqueur, lemon juice and orange juice to mask the various spirits used throughout. Strong and yet sweet. The cocktail is finished with either a slice of orange or a twisted peel of orange rind.

name: Canelazo
description: Cinnamon hot cocktail (para el chachay de Ecuador)

name: Cape Codder
description: More commonly known as a Vodka-Cranberry, it is a simple refreshing beverage originally created by the Ocean Spray cranberry growing company as the 'Red Devil'.

name: Casino
description: The Casino, which appeared in Harry Craddock's 1930 Savoy Cocktail Book, falls into a category of cocktails called Daisies. Each of these drinks includes a spirit, citrus, and a flavored sweetener.

name: Champagne Soup
description: The Champagne Soup is a French cocktail, varying from the Angevine Soup. This is a recipe for six people. Share it!

name: Christmas Tonic
description: This gin and sparkling apple juice makes an easy seasonal twist on a gin and tonic which is ideal to serve at a Christmas party.

name: Cloud 9
description: Cathay Pacific is known for its excellent in-flight service, but that might just be because they love getting passengers liquored up during the journey. “The Cloud Nine” is one of their best signature cocktails, and the combination of Cointreau, Sprite, and vodka will make those long-haul flights just fly by.

name: Clover Club Cocktail
description: A delicious pre-prohibition cocktail where the signature ingredient is raspberry.

name: Comfort Collins
description: A Tom Collins with a Southern twist

name: Cosmopolitan
description: One thing is certain, the Cosmopolitan is outdated, but just like the cocktail as a whole, it just needs a little help to get back on track!

name: Cranberry Mimosa
description: A nice drink to shake your morning.

name: Cranberry Tonic
description: When cranberry finds a tonic side to surprise us...

name: Cuba Libre
description: Cuba Libre is a cocktail based on rum and cola.

name: Daddy don't go
description: A really great cocktail from the Caribbean.

name: Dark and Stormy
description: A highball cocktail made with dark rum and ginger beer, served over ice.

name: Death in the Gulf
description: A bitter favorite of Ernest Hemingway's, this drink is a tart pick me up on a sultry summer afternoon.

name: Dubliner
description: This cocktail is adapted from the original recipe of Gary & Mardee Regan (cocktail experts) created in 1999 in New York.

name: El Diablo
description: A popular tequila cocktail with the cassis melding perfectly with the ginger and the agave flavour of the tequila.

name: El Presidente
description: A classic cuban cocktail from the 1930s.

name: Gimlet
description: A refreshing classic cocktail made with gin, lime juice and simple syrup. Perfect for the summer.

name: Gin Tonic
description: A classic cocktail with just a few ingredients that is sure to accentuate the botanical flavors of any gin.

name: Godchild
description: The Godchild, which is classified as a dessert cocktail, is perfect for novices as it is simple to make and smooth and easy to drink. This is a variation of the classic Godfather cocktail, which is a mix of Scotch whisky and Amaretto and was named after Marlon Brando, who had a penchant for this drink and was obviously best known for is role as the head of a mafia family in The Godfather movies. If you fancy something a little more adventurous, you can pour the Godchild cocktail over a bowl of vanilla ice cream, for a boozy dessert.

name: Godfather
description: An IBA official cocktail with a smokey but refreshing flavour.

name: Greyhound
description: The refreshing mixture of grapefruit and vodka makes the greyhound an ideal choice for a summertime refresher.

name: Kamikaze
description: The Kamikaze is a cocktail that really has it in itself! The quite strong effect owes the short drink its name, because the effects after an excessive consumption of the Kamikaze are sometimes compared with the devastating effects of the Kamikaze pilots. At parties, the short drink is often served in tubes as a shot. There are numerous variations in the mixing ratio - in some recipes, for example, the amount of vodka is doubled. This short drink is also known as Kamikaze Blue or Blue Kamikaze, where Curacao Blue is used instead of the clear Triple Sec.

name: Kir Royale
description: A variation to the traditional Kir recipe where Burgundy Aligote wine has been replaced with Champagne. This quick and easy recipe is perfect for the holidays and all major celebrations.

name: Ladykiller
description: With a Ladykiller you are never alone! Tastes deliciously fresh and fruity at the same time.

name: Long Island Iced Tea
description: A Long Island Iced Tea is a type of alcoholic mixed drink typically made with vodka, tequila, light rum, triple sec, gin, and a splash of cola, which gives the drink the same amber hue as its namesake.

name: Lynchburg Lemonade
description: A cocktail and long drink made with, among other ingredients, Jack Daniel's Tennessee whiskey. It is named after Lynchburg, Tennessee, home of the Jack Daniel's distillery.

name: Mai Tai
description: Fruity and refreshing, a sip of this will have you laid back on the beach in no time!

name: Manhattan
description: The Manhattan is a short drink cocktail that can be served as an aperitif.

name: Margarita
description: A margarita is a cocktail consisting of tequila, orange liqueur, and lime juice often served with salt on the rim of the glass.

name: Negroni
description: The Negroni is an iconic Italian cocktail, also considered an apéritif.

name: Negroski
description: Negroski is a variation of the Negroni in which gin is replaced with vodka.

name: Old Fashioned
description: The Old Fashioned is a cocktail made by muddling sugar with bitters, adding whiskey, garnished with a citrus rind.

name: Pina Colada
description: Pina Colada

name: Screwdriver
description: Screwdriver

name: Sex on the beach
description: In the name of a cocktail, beach is equivalent to cranberry juice. It was created by the T.G.I. Friday's.

name: Swimming Pool
description: Any swimming pool cocktail includes coconut cream or syrup and pineapple juice. In some recipes, cream is still included. Blue Curaçao provides the typical turquoise color of the cocktail. Rum or vodka are often included as further alcohol.

name: Tequila Sunrise
description: A simple tequila cocktail with layered colors.

name: Touch Down
description: In American football, a touchdown is a six-point gain when the ball is carried or thrown over the opponent's end line. Well, the parallels are clear. A hit and point win is the Tocuh Down Cocktail in any case also. This cocktail with vodka is arranged with lots of fruit juice flavors and apricot brandy. In our recipe we show you how easy it is to prepare this drink. This way you will achieve a real touch down and score points with your guests at every party.

name: Zombie
description: The Zombie is a cocktail made of fruit juices, liqueurs, and various rums. It first appeared in late 1934. It was popularized on the East coast soon afterward at the 1939 New York World's Fair.
